data.chText: 震惊；恐惧；厌恶
data.enText: a feeling of great shock, fear or disgust

data.chText: 人们惊恐地看着飞机坠落到地面上。
data.enText: People watched in horror as the plane crashed to the ground.

data.chText: 他惊恐失色地问医生是否认定他患了癌症。
data.enText: With a look of horror, he asked if the doctor thought he had cancer.

data.chText: 想到被孤零零地留下，她就不寒而栗。
data.enText: The thought of being left alone filled her with horror.

data.chText: 看到一只巨大的蜘蛛，她吓得直退。
data.enText: She recoiled in horror at the sight of an enormous spider.

data.chText: 他很恐惧，感到自己都快哭了。
data.enText: To his horror , he could feel himself starting to cry (= it upset him very much) .

data.chText: 她吓得目瞪口呆。
data.enText: Her eyes were wide with horror.

data.chText: 对某事物的强烈畏惧（或憎恨）
data.enText: a great fear or hatred of sth

data.chText: 恐惧深水
data.enText: a horror of deep water

data.chText: 大多数人都十分害怕当众讲话。
data.enText: Most people have a horror of speaking in public.

data.chText: （某事物）令人厌恶的性质；（尤指）震惊性，恐怖性
data.enText: the very unpleasant nature of sth, especially when it is shocking or frightening

data.chText: 这次悲惨事故的真相已开始逐渐清晰了。
data.enText: The full horror of the accident was beginning to become clear.

data.chText: 那次袭击的恐怖景象在他的梦中一再重现。
data.enText: In his dreams he relives the horror of the attack.

data.chText: 极其不愉快的（或可怕的）经历
data.enText: a very unpleasant or frightening experience

data.chText: 战争的恐怖经历
data.enText: the horrors of war

data.chText: 恐怖故事（或电影等）
data.enText: a type of book, film/movie, etc. that is designed to frighten people

data.chText: 你可以在这一部分找恐怖和科幻小说。
data.enText: In this section you'll find horror and science fiction.

data.chText: 恐怖片 / 电影
data.enText: a horror film/movie

data.chText: 调皮捣蛋的孩子
data.enText: a child who behaves badly

data.chText: 她的儿子是个小捣蛋鬼。
data.enText: Her son is a little horror.
horror of horrors

data.chText: 极其糟糕

data.enText: or
used to emphasize how bad a situation is

data.chText: 我站起来讲话，可是——老天爷呀——我发现自己忘了带讲稿。
data.enText: I stood up to speak and─horror of horrors─realized I had left my notes behind.
shock horror

data.chText: （假装震惊时说）震惊
data.enText: used when you pretend to be shocked by sth that is not really very serious or surprising

simple_means.memory_skill: horr 怕 + or 情况，状态，性质 → 恐怖

means: 对某事物的强烈畏惧(或憎恨)
极其不愉快的（或可怕的）经历

ex.chText: 没人知道她为什么惊慌地逃走了。
ex.enText: No one knows why she fled in panic.

ex.chText: 他发现无法按期完成任务，慌了起来。
ex.enText: He got into a panic when he realised that he couldn't meet the deadline.

synonyms.bx: 指突然产生的强烈的害怕或紧张之感，使人无法理智地思考和行动。

ex.chText: 对于食品污染的增多，人们越来越恐惧。
ex.enText: There is growing alarm at the increase in food contamination.

synonyms.bx: 指因意识到可能发生的坏事或危险而产生的惊恐或担忧之感。

ex.chText: 她看到一条大蛇时吓得往后退。
ex.enText: She recoiled with horror when she saw a big snake.

ex.chText: 他发现外套上沾有血迹，大为惊恐。
ex.enText: To his horror, he realized there were blood stains on his coat.

synonyms.bx: 指非常强烈的震惊或恐惧之感，含有厌恶的意味。

ex.chText: 几颗炸弹接二连三地爆炸，她害怕地尖叫起来。
ex.enText: Several bombs went off one after another, and she screamed in terror.

ex.chText: 听到枪响，孩子们胆战心惊。
ex.enText: The sound of gun shots struck terror into the children's hearts.

synonyms.bx: 强调极度的恐惧，语义最强。

data.enText: horror of horrors

data.chText: 极其糟糕

data.enText: or
used to emphasize how bad a situation is

data.chText: 我站起来讲话，可是——老天爷呀——我发现自己忘了带讲稿。
data.enText: I stood up to speak and─horror of horrors─realized I had left my notes behind.
shock horror

data.chText: （假装震惊时说）震惊
data.enText: used when you pretend to be shocked by sth that is not really very serious or surprising

example: the painting that others found so beautiful was a horror to him

value.def: Horror is a feeling of great shock, fear, and worry caused by something extremely unpleasant.

example.ex: As I watched in horror the boat began to power away from me.
example.tran: 我惊恐万分地看着船加足马力从我身边开走了。

value.def: If you have a horror of something, you are afraid of it or dislike it very much.
The horror of something, especially something that hurts people, is its very great unpleasantness.

example.ex: ...the horror of this most bloody of civil wars.
example.tran: 这场极其血腥的内战的惨烈

value.def: You can refer to extremely unpleasant or frightening experiences as horrors .

example.ex: Can you possibly imagine all the horrors we have undergone since I last wrote you?
example.tran: 你能想象得出自从我上次给你写信以来我们所经历的所有可怕事情吗？

value.tran: 极其不愉快（或可怕）的经历

value.def: If you refer to someone or something as a horror, you mean that you think they are very unpleasant or ugly.

example.ex: Our host was arrogant and offensive. How his sweet wife could tolerate such a horror was baffling.
example.tran: 招待我们的男主人傲慢无礼。真不知道他温柔的妻子怎么能容忍这样一个讨厌的家伙。

value.tran: 极讨厌（或丑陋）的人（或事物）

value.def: A horror film or story is intended to be very frightening.
value.tran: （影片或故事）情节恐怖的，惊悚的

value.def: You can refer to an account of a very unpleasant experience or event as a horror story.

example.ex: ...a horror story about lost luggage while flying.
example.tran: 乘飞机旅行时丢失行李的糟糕经历

value.def: Horror of horrors is used to refer to something that you consider to be the worst part of a situation.

example.ex: The company has already boosted its share of the UK tea market with its round tea bags. Now it is successfully converting the nation to (horror of horrors) instant tea.
example.tran: 该公司已经凭借其袋泡茶提高了自己在英国茶叶市场的占有份额。现在它正在成功地使该国人民改喝（最可怕不过的）速溶茶。

trans: 惊恐地；恐怖；恐惧地；恐怖地
恐怖电影；恐怖片；恐怖 片；恐怖；恐怖電影
恐怖小说；骇小说；驱之一；恐惧小说
恐怖故事；可怕经历的描述；吓人报道

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to shudder, to dread 颤抖；害怕
rootsaffixes.title: hor(r)

partsOfSpeech.dec: ab 加强 + hor 颤抖；害怕 → 因怕生恨 → 憎恨
abhor的形容词
horr 颤抖；害怕 + ible 可…的 → 可怕的
horr 颤抖；害怕 + id …的 → 让人颤抖的 → 可怕的
horr 颤抖；害怕 + ify 使… → 使恐怖
horr 颤抖；害怕 + or 表状态 → 恐怖
arbitrate 仲裁 + ator 人 → 仲裁人
conspire 同谋 + ator 人 → 阴谋者
create 创造 + ator 人 → 创作者
dictate 命令 + or 人 →〔唯一〕发布命令的人 → 独裁者
govern 统治，管理 + or 人 → 州长，地方长官
invent 发明 + or 人 → 发明家
moderate 缓和 + ator 人 → 调解人
sail 航行 + or 人 → 水手
sculpt 雕刻 + or 人 → 雕刻家
spect 看 + ator 人 → 观众，旁观者
supervise 监督；管理 + or 人 → 监督者；主管
translate 翻译 + ator 人 → 译员（者）
vend 出售 + or 人 → 小贩
com 加强 + press 压 + or 器物 → 压缩机
detect 察觉 + or 器物 → 探测器
insulate 使绝缘 + ator 器物 → 绝缘体
radiate 发出，放射 + ator 器物 → 暖气片；散热器
re 一再 + cept 拿 + or 器物 → 感受器
resist 抵抗，反抗 + or 器物 → 电阻器
tract 拖，拉 + or 器物 → 拖拉机
err 犯错 + or 情况，状态，性质 → 错误，差错
horr 怕 + or 情况，状态，性质 → 恐怖
terr 怕 + or 情况，状态，性质 → 恐怖
trem 颤抖 + or 情况，状态，性质 → 颤抖
